title: Forecasting the 2016-2017 Central Apennines Earthquake Sequence with a Neural Point Process. (arXiv:2301.09948v2 [physics.geo-ph] UPDATED)
abstract: Point processes have been dominant in modeling the evolution of seismicity for decades, with the Epidemic Type Aftershock Sequence (ETAS) model being most popular. Recent advances in machine learning have constructed highly flexible point process models using neural networks to improve upon existing parametric models. We investigate whether these flexible point process models can be applied to short-term seismicity forecasting by extending an existing temporal neural model to the magnitude domain and we show how this model can forecast earthquakes above a target magnitude threshold. We first demonstrate that the neural model can fit synthetic ETAS data, however, requiring less computational time because it is not dependent on the full history of the sequence. By artificially emulating short-term aftershock incompleteness in the synthetic dataset, we find that the neural model outperforms ETAS. translated_title: 用神经点过程预测2016-2017年中央阿彭宁地震序列
translated_abstract: 近几十年来，点过程一直是地震活动演化建模领域的主流方法，其中Epidemic Type Aftershock Sequence (ETAS)模型最为流行。近年来，机器学习的不断发展利用神经网络构建高度灵活的点过程模型以改进现有的参数模型。本文通过将现有的时间神经模型扩展到震级领域，探究这些灵活的点过程模型是否可以应用于短期地震预报，并展示此模型如何预测高于目标震级阈值的地震。本文首先证明了神经模型可以拟合ETAS合成数据，且需要较少的计算时间，因为它不依赖于整个序列的完整历史。通过在合成数据集中模拟短期余震不完整性，我们发现神经模型的表现优于ETAS。利用2016-2017年中央阿彭宁地震序列的新增强目录，我们预测了未来的地震活动。
tldr: 本文利用神经点过程模型对2016-2017年阿彭宁地震序列进行了预测，结果表明神经模型优于传统ETAS模型，可以应用于短期地震预报。
en_tdlr: This paper uses a neural point process model to forecast the 2016-2017 Central Apennines earthquake sequence, showing that the neural model outperforms the traditional ETAS model and can be applied to short-term earthquake prediction.
